key_insight: A hybrid architecture (Efficient Vision Mamba) that combines multi‑head selective state‑space models with selective scanning achieves high‑fidelity MRI super‑resolution while drastically reducing compute and inference time.
problem_solved: Addresses the fidelity–efficiency trade‑off in MRI super‑resolution by preserving anatomical detail with a computationally efficient model suitable for clinical deployment.
method: Multi‑Head Selective State‑Space Models (MHSSM) to capture long‑range anatomical context with low computational cost.
Hybrid Selective Scanning: dynamically prioritize and process high‑information regions (edges/structures) at higher resolution while scanning low‑priority areas with cheaper operations.
Lightweight decoder and streamlined training/inference pipeline designed for fast runtime and reduced FLOPs without sacrificing PSNR/SSIM.
impact: Makes MRI super‑resolution practical for clinical workflows and resource‑limited environments by reducing latency and compute while maintaining anatomical fidelity—helpful for ML practitioners building efficient medical imaging systems or deploying on edge hardware.

paper_title: Efficient Vision Mamba for MRI Super-Resolution via Hybrid Selective Scanning
paper_authors: Mojtaba Safari, Shansong Wang, Vanessa L Wildman, Mingzhe Hu, Zach Eidex
